title: Abstract Classes
subject: Java
theory:
A class with `abstract` keyword. It can have abstract and non-abstract methods.

*   **Goal**: Provide a common base with some default implementation, but force subclasses to implement specific parts.

interview_questions.question: Can abstract class be final?
interview_questions.answer: No. Abstract needs to be extended. Final prevents extension. They are opposites.

practice_problems.problem: Can an abstract class have 0 abstract methods?

real_world_use_cases.description: Abstract class defines the flow (algorithm), steps are abstract methods implemented by subclasses.

exam_notes: If a class has at least one abstract method, the class MUST be abstract.
summary: The middle ground between a Class and an Interface.
